fields.description:
Hi,

Users of our Jira instance tend to quote emails as issue comments. This is good however it ruins the Activity Stream, which gets hard to read and takes long time to load. 

I'd wish I could limit the length of Activity Stream entry to e.g. 200 characters. It should work like newspaper rss feeds, where only the beginning of articles is available. 

Thank you,
Lukasz
fields.summary: Limiting the length of Activity Stream entries

fields.description:
User cannot be serialized/deserialized because it has fields that are not serializable - namely the various OSUser provider implementations have instance variables of Loggers.
Under JIRA v4.0 there is also an unserializable Concurrent Map used for caching.

Seraph puts the User object in a Session attribute.
When Weblogic tries to deserialise the Session attributes, it fails on the User stored in "seraph_defaultauthenticator_user".
WLS restores the other attirbutes and sets "seraph_defaultauthenticator_user" to null.
To Seraph, this means that the User is no longer logged in.
fields.summary: The OSUser User object is not serializable, and this can cause JIRA users to get logged out.

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce:
 * Create new project and 2 users (e.g. 'admin' and 'admin2')
 * Create one issue 
 * Log in as "admin", run this Jelly script:
{code}
<jira:TransitionWorkflow key="${key}" user="admin2" workflowAction="Close Issue" resolution="Fixed"/>
{code}
 * The transition will be set to "admin" and not "admin2"

h4. Cause:
Introduced by rev 78483 in TransitionWorkflow.doTag()

h4. Update:
There is now a patch attached to this bug report. See below for details.
The construction of WorkflowTransitionUtil was moved to before the following call:
{code}
authenticationContext.setUser(user);
{code}
This results in the transition user being set to the executing user at all times, and the specified user being ignored.
fields.summary: Jelly Tag (TransitionWorkflow) ignores user attribute

We were told that Atlassian supports officially 4 languages only (BTW, nothing about it in User Guide), Russian is not there. But what was in Russian in 3.13 is in English in JIRA 4.0 including main menu. :(

fields.description:
the Admin -> General Configuration -> Edit page says this re: email from address:

====
Specifies the From: header format in notification emails. Available variables are ${fullname}, ${email} and ${email.hostname}
Default value is ${fullname} (JIRA), evaluating to eg. "From: John Doe (JIRA) <jira@company.com>". The actual address (jira@company.com) cannot be specified here - it is determined by the mail server or individual project.
====

Please add the JIRA username to this list as ${username}. I can't think of any other obvious fields that should be available (if there are please add them also) but certainly the username should.

(Also add a description for each of these fields, or a link to a webpage with these descriptions. fullname is the user's full name. There is no example for "email" so I wasn't sure whether it was the server's email address or the user's email address, until I tried it.)
fields.summary: make the JIRA username available as a field for the email "From" address

fields.description:
If a JIRA instance is integrated with an external repository that allows lowercased chars only, the permissions will be lost, since JIRA considers *GROUP-ABC* different from *group-abc* (Jira allows Groups to have uppercased characters).

An example with Crowd:

Steps to reproduce:
1-) Before integrating JIRA and Crowd, go to JIRA and create group GROUPABC (uppercased)
2-) Assign to this group many different *Global Permissions*, *Notification Schemes*, *Permission Schemes* and *Workflow Schemes*
3-) In Crowd create user admin and add him to the normal JIRA groups and to group *groupabc* (lowercased)
4-) Integrate JIRA and Crowd
5-) Login to JIRA using admin
6-) Go to the Group Browser and click on *groupabc* -> None of the *Global Permissions*, *Notification Schemes*, *Permission Schemes* and *Workflow Schemes* is assigned to *groupabc*
7-) Opening the *Global Permissions*, *Notification Schemes*, *Permission Schemes* and *Workflow Schemes* edit pages may throw exceptions

The problem would happen to the user as well if there is any data in the DB (permissions, properties, etc) that makes reference to his *user name* not to the user ID.

When comparing Users/Groups names from the DB and the Users/Groups external repositories, JIRA should do it in a *case-insensitive* way.
fields.summary: Groups with uppercased characters break permissions for External User/Groups Repositories

fields.description:
com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soap.service.SearchServiceImpl.addFreeTextCondition() line 223 adds the environment as a field to search. This assumes that the user performing the query has this field visible. The following error occurs if that is not the case:

com.atlassian.jira.rpc.exception.RemoteValidationException: Query validation failed: Field 'environment' does not exist.

The query should still work if the environment field is not visible to the user.

This is used by:
getIssuesFromTextSearch()
getIssuesFromTextSearchWithProject()

can we do the equivalent of a text ~ " " search?
fields.summary: addFreeTextCondition() assumes environment field is visible to user performing the query

fields.description:
When we put in a time estimate of 1 day and 6 hours (1d 6h), Jira assumes there is 30 hrs of work remaining.
If the time estimate is one week (1w), Jira assumes there is 168hrs (7days*24hrs) remaining.

Is there a way to change this such that one day is for example, 8 hours?
fields.summary: Time estimate in Jira may be misleading when using days and weeks

fields.description:
This request came up during discussion after Scott's presentation at the JIRA 4.0 Launch in SF. The request was raised by a customer, and others mentioned that it's a question often asked.

Document how to make sure I or my users get a daily summary of updated issues rather than continual notifications each time an issue is updated.

Later discussions with the tech writers revealed that you can do this by creating a filter on date last updated, subscribing to the filter and turning off notifications. You can also fine tune your filter via JQL if necessary.
fields.summary: Document how to make sure I or my users get a daily summary of updated issues rather than continual notifications

fields.description:
I created three releases, all scheduled for Monday (last week, today, and next Monday).  This is what I see on the Summary page:

!versions.jpg!

This is somewhat confusing.  Today is Monday and we see two releases that _could be interpreted to be the same_: "Today" and "Monday".  But what's worse is if I "release" the versions "Release 1.0" and "Release 1.1".  I now see this:

!versions-released.jpg!

As today is Monday, I get the impression that "Release 1.2" is due _today_, even though the real release date is _next week_!  I propose that two changes need to be made:

# Change it so that a "Release 1.2" description refers to Monday as "Next Monday" or "Next week Monday".
# *Additionally*, show the full date with the "friendly" description: "Today: November 16, 2009" or "Next Monday: November 23, 2009"
fields.summary: Project Summary Versions Due shows misleading date information

fields.description:
Hello,

the documentation should differentiate more clearly the use case of "required fields" and "field contents" validation provided by third party plugin "JIRA Suite Utilities".

Users may use the plugin validator to require data entry upon issue creation causing possible confusion as:
# such "required fields" are not flagged as such in the form
# such fields can be cleared at a later time which is not what the user may have intended when not using the _required fields_ option
# plugins such as GreenHopper will not detect the requirement as implemented by the workflow validator and fail later during usage




Regards,
Edoardo

fields.description:
In my Co., We have added a new custom field called 'Pushing Forward Manager'. There are 4 teams in my office, with each having a separate head. When we assign issues to a person, say when we select A1 of team A in the assignee list, we want the Pushing Forward Manager(PFM) field to be auto-populated with the head of team A. As the assignee changes then PFM also changes accordingly. The admin will have an option to manage all these things at his end. He prescribes the group and the team head. He will also be allowed to change the team head or switch teams for a user. If an issue is assigned to a user who is the team head then the same user should be populated in the PFM field. 

The main idea for such a request is because the developers and the testers works on various issues on a daily basis. If the head of the team knows that his team members has the following issues he will be the driving force in solving the issue before due date.
fields.summary: Changing values for a custom field on assignment of an issue
Are you sure that everyone should be able to raise new features like this?

fields.description:
When setting up a JNDI DS provider under WebSphere 6.1, an implementation classname is required. For PostgreSQL, there are currently two providers that can be used according to http://jdbc.postgresql.org/documentation/84/ds-ds.html:
{quote}
Applications: DataSource

PostgreSQL™ includes two implementations of DataSource , as shown in Table 11.2, "DataSource Implementations". One that does pooling and the other that does not. The pooling implementation does not actually close connections when the client calls the close method, but instead returns the connections to a pool of available connections for other clients to use. This avoids any overhead of repeatedly opening and closing connections, and allows a large number of clients to share a small number of database connections.

The pooling data-source implementation provided here is not the most feature-rich in the world. Among other things, connections are never closed until the pool itself is closed; there is no way to shrink the pool. As well, connections requested for users other than the default configured user are not pooled. Its error handling sometimes cannot remove a broken connection from the pool. In general it is not recommended to use the PostgreSQL™ provided connection pool. Check your application server or check out the excellent jakarta commons DBCP project.

Table 11.2. DataSource Implementations

Pooling	Implementation Class
No	org.postgresql.ds.PGSimpleDataSource
Yes	org.postgresql.ds.PGPoolingDataSource

Both implementations use the same configuration scheme. JDBC requires that a DataSource be configured via JavaBean properties, shown in Table 11.3, "DataSource Configuration Properties", so there are get and set methods for each of these properties.

{quote}

Can the required provider be discovered and explictly documented as the one a customer using WebSphere 6.1 connecting to a PostgreSQL DB must use.
fields.summary: WebSphere 6.1 JNDI DS Provider - PostgreSQL JDBC provider implementation classname needs to be stipulated

fields.description:

fields.summary: Update JNDI DS documentation for WebSphere from 5.1 to 6.1

h3. Cause

The JIRAProfilingFilter has been set to be auto-enabled as per our docs: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+and+Profiling#LoggingandProfiling-Topermanentlyenableprofiling%3A

This causes some weirdness with the way that the JIRA "system" is restarted now in 4.0 during Setup.

h3. Work around

Disable the JIRAProfilingFilter until JIRA has been set up successfully. You can enable it from the Administration interface temporarily.

fields.description:
# Open several JIRA tabs, and 2 tabs with 2 different filters
# From a filter1 tab, select a ticket
# Click 'Return to Search'
# Now go to filter2 and click on a ticket
# Notice that the 'Return to Search' link now shows the filter1 name. Filter2 is gone. 

As a QA person, I have 2 filters constantly working:
# current resolved
# recently added

As soon as I switch filters and look at a ticket, I lose my second filter and need to reset it. So I continually need to work around this.

fields.description:
we have a time-reporting-system of our own. 
now we added a WEB-Service to add worklog diretly to JIRA-Calls using the WebServicemethod addWorklogAndAutoAdjustRemainingEstimate

Probing with single requests everything looked fine. 
Then we decided to do also the migration of the old entries: about 47.000 --> our APP-Server (using paralell Web-Service-Queues, JBOSS) sent them to the JIRA-system without error.
All Work-log-entries have been added to the propper calls. 
BUT: the data-field TIMESPENT on the issue is calulated WRONG. (see pciture attached) 
And I am not sure what happend to the remaining estimate field ... 

We guess, the problem is eigther the web-service is NOT multi-thread-proof or the caching of the issue-data results in a wrong update of the issue-record-field TIMESPENT.
fields.summary: SOAP: addWorklogAndAutoAdjustRemainingEstimate, sum of timespent on issue is wrong

fields.description:
copied from / also see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-47192

When a user goes to "Manage Dashboard" and adds a new dashboard, the form field "description" allows a user to input a lot of text. On save it is not validated how many chars are in that field. If there are more than 255 chars in it, JIRA throws a System Error, because the according database field seems to be text(255).

INSERT INTO portalpage (ID, USERNAME, PAGENAME, DESCRIPTION, SEQUENCE, FAV_COUNT) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Data truncation: Data too long for column 'DESCRIPTION' at row 1))


the error is:

"Data too long for column 'DESCRIPTION' at row 1"

after:

INSERT INTO portalpage (ID, USERNAME, PAGENAME, DESCRIPTION, SEQUENCE, FAV_COUNT)...


The table portalpage looks like this:

{code}
mysql> describe portalpage;
+-------------+---------------+------+-----+---------+-------+
| Field       | Type          | Null | Key | Default | Extra |
+-------------+---------------+------+-----+---------+-------+
| ID          | decimal(18,0) | NO   | PRI |         |       |
| USERNAME    | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| PAGENAME    | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| DESCRIPTION | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| SEQUENCE    | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| FAV_COUNT   | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
+-------------+---------------+------+-----+---------+-------+
{code}

so, "DESCRIPTION" is varchar(255). (max. 255 chars)

I can confirm inserting 254 chars into the description field does not cause the error, while 256 chars does.

The problem is just that the formfield does not check if the user inserts more characters.

We dont even need a workaround, see it just as a bug report, so you can fix it in a future version

It would be better if either the database field would allow more than 255 chars (if possible), or the form would be validated and tell the user something like "your description text is too long" instead.

This is more for your information than expecting a work-around right now, i have already informed our user to use only up to 254 chars to avoid this.


----

System Error

A system error has occurred.

Please try submitting this problem via the Support Request Page

Otherwise, please create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:

1. a description of your problem
2. cut & paste the error and system information found below
3. attach the application server log file ( /home/jira/atlassian-jira.log )

fields.description:
When adding our customers to our JIRA each time we have to instruct them how to configure preferences for comfortable work with JIRA. This includes language preferences (they need Russian), HTML format for email, etc.
Would be very good that JIRA admins could do it not interacting with the customers.

The same relates to the dashboards - ability to add shared dashboards for the customers.
fields.summary: Ability to edit user preferences when adding new user

fields.description:
Add function to jira to translate issue details on the fly using google translate.

Available in issue view mode (configurable target languages) to do a dynamic translation of all issue text. Also available in edit mode to translate description text. Especially useful for pasting content into description in the source language and translating back to the core language.
fields.summary: Google Translate integration for issues

fields.description:
We put the title of the JIRA instance into the <title> element of the activity stream. If the JIRA instance is named something like "Aktivitätsstrom" then we appear to htmlEscape the result too many times.

I raised [STRM-5|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/STRM-5] to track this.
fields.summary: activity stream overly-escapes the title in JIRA

fields.description: Lets clean up any known issues with translations as part of 4.0.2
fields.summary: Translation update for de, fr, jp

fields.description:
The JiraWebActionSupport.properties file allows you to change the issue field names that are displayed.

However, the advance search does not use those names, it uses the default names.

If one follows the directions for customizing text:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Customizing+text
the names uses for fields can be changed.

A common use case for this is changing "Priority" to "Severity".
However, when you use advanced search, it will still show you "priority = <whatever>".
That is confusing for the user who expects a name that matches what is displayed elsewhere.

Please change advanced search to use one of those properties, or add a new one for this purpose.

To reproduce, follow the instructions for customizing text and then try an advanced search on the field you changed.
fields.summary: Advanced Search should use the issue field names defined in property files

fields.description:
When using the diff utility, sometimes I would like to be able to select text from both versions (not one or the other)

It would be helpful if the diff utility had a split / swap / join feature, similar to xxdiff.

For example, suppose one of the differences appears as follows:
{noformat}
left text 1     right text 1
left text 2     right text 2
left text 3
{noformat}

Currently, diff will allow me to select the left text, or the right text, but not both.

So if we had a "split" option, the diff would look like:
{noformat}
left text 1
left text 2
left text 3
----------------------------
                right text 1
                right text 2
{noformat}

That would allow me to select both.

But if the order is not what is desired, then "swap":

{noformat}
                right text 1
                right text 2
----------------------------
left text 1
left text 2
left text 3
{noformat}

Pressing the button again would "join" and put us back to where we started.

{noformat}
left text 1     right text 1
left text 2     right text 2
left text 3
{noformat}

There were a couple of times when I could have used such a feature.

Thanks,
Kevin Randolph
fields.summary: Diff utility should have a split/swap/join feature

fields.description:
The current activity stream shows all changes (i believe) that occur in JIR (subject to filters by project, or _selecting_ specific users). This is related to the RSS feed.
However, most people know what changes they've made themselves, so the major benefit of this Activity Stream would be to see other users' activities. 

I would like to see the option to pull down an activity stream of OTHER users, in the portlet -- and importantly for me, the RSS feed (http://jira.myhost.co.nz/plugins/servlet/streams?os_authType=basic).

I suggest this could be effected by one of:

A) Modify Portlet config panel, to include a checkbox "[x] Exclude changes by current user" (in addition to the username filters). Importantly (for me), the RSS feed would need to honour this exclusion.
B) Allow operators in the username fields -- such "!myusername" to represent "NOT myusername". This would be most useful if you could use "!currentUser()" as a username value.
C) Allow a variation to the RSS field URL, to specify exclusions .... e.g. "...os_authType=basic&excludeuser=myusername"

In my opinion, option (A) is probably the easiest to understand for new users to JIRA and has a simple to understand interface. B and C, while perhaps more flexible, would likely require reading a document/help text to discover (which, given the developer audience of JIRA is probably acceptable if option A is undesirable).
fields.summary: Ability to excluded updates for current user from Activity Stream (Portlet and RSS feeds)

fields.description: When a Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget is configured to show statistics on a Filter that does not match any issues, the message "The filter for this gadget did not return any issues" is displayed.  I would suggest that either the word "filter" should link to the Issue Navigator view for that filter, or that the name of the filter should still be displayed as a clickable link.

fields.description:
We use the roadmap quite a bit. It used to include the issue priority and it would be great if we could have this back.

It used to sort by resolution status and issue priority, which meant that the most important stuff was at the top. Not sure how it sorts now.

When there are more than 50 issues, they aren't all shown. It would be useful either if we could have an option to show all issues or if it was sorted so that the unresolved issues are at the top. As things stand at the moment, you can have unresolved issues which don't show up in the road map.
fields.summary: Reinstate some road map features

fields.description:
In the selection box for the Project Gadget Set up in addition to having Projects and Categories, you should be able to select current user, Group or Project Role

I am setting up Generic Dashboards for use across the organisations, and other gadgets allow you to select Current User etc.

It would be good if in setting up the Projects Portlet, you could configure it by default to show the projects in which the Current User has a project role (not JIRA-User
fields.summary: Projects Gadget - Add Current User and/or Group and/or Project Role to Projects

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Goto Administration tab and click CVS Modules.
3. Configure it. Now click edit and change timeout time to 5 sec or whatever in which it will timeout.
4. Click update.

Result:
1. On UI there will be user friendly message but in logs there is stack trace.

Expected:
1. No stack trace should be there.
fields.summary: JIRA throws a stack trace in log file if CVS update fail due to timeout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-19686].
  {panel}

Any java written application which interfaces with JIRA as a client, via the SOAP and/or XML/RPC interface, because they are themselves their own JVM, maintain a list of 'clean' and 'dirty', references to objects which the client knows about, across the wire.

When a remote client of JIRA calls a regular System.gc() as a part of it's usual automated garbage collection routine, it will notify the remote peer (in this case, JIRA), that any objects it was holding, of which JIRA was tracking in it's own reference object graph, are now dirty and those references should be cleaned.

Currently the Hotspot JVM performs this action as a serial, single-threaded System garbage collection. This can lead to rare circumstances whereby a remote client, if poorly written, or resource starved in the JVM, can fatally spam JIRA with full system GC calls until (if) it recovers.

The effect is similar to:
{noformat}378.030: [GC [PSYoungGen: 13733K->10886K(418816K)] 257769K->254922K(1336320K), 0.0438305 secs] [Times: user=0.05 sys=0.00, real=0.05 secs] 
378.074: [Full GC (System) [PSYoungGen: 10886K->0K(418816K)] [ParOldGen: 244036K->244138K(917504K)] 254922K->244138K(1336320K) [PSPermGen: 66190K->66190K(135168K)], 1.5175107 secs] [Times: user=4.92 sys=0.05, real=1.51 secs] 
379.924: [GC [PSYoungGen: 15258K->712K(435328K)] 259396K->244850K(1352832K), 0.0091928 secs] [Times: user=0.00 sys=0.00, real=0.02 secs] 
379.933: [Full GC (System) [PSYoungGen: 712K->0K(435328K)] [ParOldGen: 244138K->240486K(917504K)] 244850K->240486K(1352832K) [PSPermGen: 66592K->66590K(131072K)], 1.6306610 secs] [Times: user=4.53 sys=0.00, real=1.63 secs] 
382.535: [GC [PSYoungGen: 19106K->11462K(431104K)] 259592K->251948K(1348608K), 0.0230824 secs] [Times: user=0.06 sys=0.00, real=0.03 secs] 
382.558: [Full GC (System) [PSYoungGen: 11462K->0K(431104K)] [ParOldGen: 240486K->240176K(917504K)] 251948K->240176K(1348608K) [PSPermGen: 66648K->66646K(131072K)], 1.3173999 secs] [Times: user=4.14 sys=0.00, real=1.31 secs] 
383.926: [GC [PSYoungGen: 12066K->5636K(446080K)] 252242K->245812K(1363584K), 0.0219822 secs] [Times: user=0.05 sys=0.00, real=0.03 secs] 
383.949: [Full GC (System) [PSYoungGen: 5636K->0K(446080K)] [ParOldGen: 240176K->245655K(917504K)] 245812K->245655K(1363584K) [PSPermGen: 66668K->66668K(131072K)], 1.2802751 secs] [Times: user=4.03 sys=0.00, real=1.27 secs] 
385.301: [GC [PSYoungGen: 7271K->224K(441408K)] 252926K->245879K(1358912K), 0.0217929 secs] [Times: user=0.03 sys=0.00, real=0.03 secs] {noformat}
Rendering the installation incapacitated.

From [Sun|http://java.sun.com/javase/technologies/hotspot/gc/gc_tuning_6.html#other_considerations]:

{quote}Another way applications can interact with garbage collection is by invoking full garbage collections explicitly by calling System.gc(). This can force a major collection to be done when it may not be necessary (i.e., when a minor collection would suffice), and so in general should be avoided. The performance impact of explicit garbage collections can be measured by disabling them using the flag -XX:+DisableExplicitGC, which causes the VM to ignore calls to System.gc().

One of the most commonly encountered uses of explicit garbage collection occurs with RMI's distributed garbage collection (DGC). Applications using RMI refer to objects in other virtual machines. Garbage cannot be collected in these distributed applications without occasionally collection the local heap, so RMI forces full collections periodically. {quote}Alternatively,{quote}The frequency of these collections can be controlled with properties. For example,

	 java -Dsun.rmi.dgc.client.gcInterval=3600000 -Dsun.rmi.dgc.server.gcInterval=3600000 ...
 
specifies explicit collection once per hour instead of the default rate of once per minute. However, this may also cause some objects to take much longer to be reclaimed. These properties can be set as high as Long.MAX_VALUE to make the time between explicit collections effectively infinite, if there is no desire for an upper bound on the timeliness of DGC activity.{quote}

Originates from [CSP-38789|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-38789]. Explicit remote GC can be completely disabled (ignored) via {{-XX:+DisableExplicitGC}} in Tomcat startup parameters, under Sun Hotspot. Recommend we add this to the distribution startup parameters. Ignoring client requests for GC should not have any impact moving forward as JIRA has already been notified that the object is dirty, or dereferenced, and will reclaim it as part of normal collections.
fields.summary: disable distributed garbage collection via RMI

fields.description:
Vista/Win7 has the User Account Control (UAC). One of the things it does is run programs with non-administrator privileges even when the user has them. The user has to explicitly allow a program to elevate to administrator privileges (sudo for Windows).

When we install JIRA using the installer, the user must grant administrator privileges. This will create "c:\Program Files(x86)\Atlassian" such that only administators have write access (very good Windows).

If you then try to run JIRA with the startup scripts (i.e. not a service) it will not work (even as an admin user) since UAC will run the program as a standard user that only have read permisisons. JIRA needs to write to (bad JIRA):

* Atlassian\JIRA4.0\logs
* Atlassian\JIRA4.0\database (if using HSQLDB).
...
* Atlassian\Application Data\JIRA (the default home directory).

In an ideal world, we would put such files in another directory (i.e. %AppData%\JIRA40\). 

We then have to throw running JIRA as a service into the mix. In this case JIRA will probably work because services run with high enough privileges that it will have write permissions. It would be nice if both methods of execution used the same file layout.
fields.summary: JIRA does not install well on Vista/Win7 with UAC and the Installer.

fields.description:
I would like to be able to customize the display of the version picker.  Preferably on a per-project basis, rather than system-wide or per-user.

Background: Our automated nightly build creates a new version number in Jira.  After several years on this project we have literally hundreds of versions.

1) I would like to be able to turn off grouping by release status and display all versions in order.

The version picker segregates Released and Unreleased versions.  This behavior is undesirable for us, so much so that we do not use the Release features of Jira.  Hence the Major priority - we are unable to use a significant portion of Jira functionality.

2) I would like to be able to tell Jira to display versions either newest-first or oldest-first.

Jira lists versions oldest first in the version picker.  We would have to scroll through hundreds of entries to get to the bottom of the list almost every time we create or fix a bug.  To work around this, we sort our versions in reverse order so that the newest versions appear at the top of the version picker list.  This results in some confusion when managing versions since the descriptive text is incorrect.  By itself, this is a Minor issue because our version management is largely automated.
fields.summary: Customize version field display

fields.description:
The accelerator key tooltip given when hovering over a button or other control specify a modifier of "Shift + Ctrl" on all versions of Firefox on Linux.  This is not correct.  

* For Firefox versions < 2 the correct Modifier is Alt and
* For Firefox versions >= 2 the correct modifier is Shift+Alt

It is worth noting that users can change the default behaviour using about:config, but that is beyond our control and scope.

See: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=349716 for a long discussion of the change from Firefox 1.5 to 2.0.
fields.summary: Modifier Key in accelerator key tooltips is incorrect for Firefox on Linux.

fields.description:
JIRA when integrated with Bamboo (with the JIRA Bamboo plugin) must have access to Bamboo on startup. This is a limitation of the Bamboo plugin.

If JIRA and Bamboo are in the same instance of Tomcat, there is no way to ensure that Bamboo will start first (Tomcat does not support this)

Further, if Bamboo is not yet started, but *is* installed on that instance of Tomcat, JIRA's request to Bamboo will block JIRA from starting up at all. This will not happen if Bamboo is on another instance.

Here's the bug in JIRA, but the problem lies in the Bamboo plugin.

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-19635
fields.summary: Document fact that JIRA and Bamboo cannot co-exist in the same instance of Tomcat.

h3. Cause

User most likely has a "null" user in their {{userbase}} table/XML backup. For example:
bq. {{<OSUser id="10015" passwordHash="..."/>}}

Prior to 4.0, this error was silently being dropped.
fields.summary: NullPointerException when clicking "User Browser" and "null" user exists in user base

fields.description:
Refering to the attached screenshots:

Note that the 'Unresolved: By Assignee' has a 'and 1 more' section because the number of issues is > 10

The 'Unresolved: By Component' and 'Unresolved: By Version' should have the same functionality. But this is not the case at the moment.
fields.summary: Browse project 'Issues' tab is missing the "and X more" section for By Component and By Version
